intro: Orthocarpus lithospermoides var. typicus, commonly known as the narrowleaf orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits that are characteristic of the genus Orthocarpus. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
